name: Jordan
partner: Civic Initiative for Democratic and EuroAtlantic Choice (Civic IDEA)
takeaway: Jordan's economic ties with the PRC are evident through investments, infrastructure projects, and economic agreements, indicating its growing economic dependency.

Cultural events, exchange projects, research partnerships, Confucius Institutes and funding from Chinese entities contribute to deepening cultural and educational ties between Jordan and China, fostering mutual understanding and cooperation in various fields.

PRC-connected entities engage with local media, professional associations, and entertainment industries, influencing public discourse and shaping perceptions through cultural products and media dissemination, reflecting China's soft power strategy.

While there are instances of political engagement between Jordan and the PRC, such as high-level meetings and diplomatic exchanges, direct political influence or interference by China in Jordanian affairs appears limited, indicating a primarily economic and cultural relationship.
description-1: In 2023, Jordan had a GDP per capita of US$4,482 and a total population of 11.35 million people.
description-2: Jordan established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1977. Jordan was ranked 132nd in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 33/100.

Media.evidence: According to the official website of the World Chinese Media Network, Jordanian media organizations are not members of the abovementioned network.
Media.note: News media is an important bridge for exchanges between countries, a bond for dialogue among civilizations, and enhancing mutual trust and friendship. I hope that Chinese and Jordanian media will positively contribute to deepening mutual understanding and friendship between our peoples, promote exchanges and cooperation in various fields, and make the common voices of developing countries better heard. (link: http://jo.china-embassy.gov.cn/eng/sbgx/202108/t20210809_8918376.htm)

Media.evidence:
https://www.jordannews.jo/Section-36/Opinion/We-don-t-need-to-respond-to-your-stories-we-need-to-share-our-own-31634
During a recent visit to Beijing, China, media delegations from Jordan visited Xinhua News Agency alongside other media delegates from Bahrain. Many important questions were raised during the meeting, including inquiries about how Chinese media collaborates with Arabic-speaking media and how China manages its image, especially in the eyes of Western media.                                                        https://arabic.cgtn.com/news/2023-08-15/1691407097334616065/index.html
15.08.2023 - The tenth training session of the Chinese International Center for Media and Cultural Exchange 2023 was launched in Beijing, organized by the Chinese Association for Public Diplomacy, with the participation of 81 newspaper journalists from 69 countries around the world, including Jordan.
He explained that the importance of inviting journalists from countries that do not have media headquarters or journalists residing in China comes through the active role in participating in this training program so that they can be trained and have the opportunity to visit some of the different Chinese provinces.
Work on establishing the center began in 2014, and since that time they invited 429 journalists from 123 countries to participate in various events. The center provided foreign journalists with the materials and information through their real-life experiences. Afterwards they found that China Completely different from the stereotype that was painted of her.              https://blnews.net/2022/08/training_course_of_the_china_international_media_exchange_center_opens/
13.08.2022-The training program includes field visits to the most important historical, cultural, and cultural landmarks in different provinces, cities, and regions in China, and the opportunity to cover the most important political and economic events during the training period, as well as giving lectures in various political and development fields to journalists and getting acquainted with the most important traditional arts and crafts, Chinese calligraphy and other activities.
Arab journalists from Jordan will participate in the training course.                                     https://petra.gov.jo/Include/InnerPage.jsp?ID=259418&lang=ar&name=news
General Director of Arab News at the Chinese News Agency (Xinhua), Shen Yong, stressed the agency's interest in expanding media cooperation with Arab countries.
He said during a Jordanian press conference that visited China at the invitation of the Chinese government, that (Xinhua) was keen on comprehensive and diverse coverage, whether in Arab countries or in other countries.

Media.note:
https://www.thefreelibrary.com/China-organised+training+programme+for+Arab+Journalists+concludes-a0494820110 
Amman, May 28 (Petra) -- A two-week training programme for Arab Journalists concluded in Beijing with the aim of boosting China's relations with the Arab world in the media field.
Some 39 journalists from ten Arab countries, including 3 from Jordan, participated in the program, which started on May 10, and included seminars, discussions and field tours to acquaint the participants with China's development experiment.
Representatives from Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates also attended a three-week "Seminar for Senior Media Staff in Arab Countries" at an unspecified date.
Details about what actually happens during those seminars are scant. But pictures published by the Chinese ministry of commerce of a seminar on the "promotion of international cooperation," held last August for 43 officials from BRI countries, showed delegates attending a lecture by Chinese officials and receiving a "graduation certificate" at the end.                 https://www.businessinsider.com/china-taught-foreign-countries-journalists-how-to-restrict-speech-2018-11      China gave foreign countries and journalists seminars on how to restrict online speech and unflattering news reports.                                                                     Representatives from Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates also attended a three-week "Seminar for Senior Media Staff in Arab Countries" at an unspecified date.

Domestic Politics.note:
In 2013 – “In early September, Manar M. Dabbas, Director of the Political Affairs Directorate at the Royal Court, and Samer I. Asfour, Director of Economic and Social Department at the Royal Court, visited China to make preparations for King Abdullah II's visit. To implement the agreement reached by leaders of the two countries on developing bilateral relations, Vice Commerce Minister Li Jinzao led a government trade delegation to Jordan in November. In December, Minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriate Affairs Joudeh led a delegation to China…
Jordanian Tourism Minister Ibrahim Saif and the president of a Jordanian journalist association Tarek Muhammad, among others, visited or attended conferences in China.” https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/xybfs_663590/gjlb_663594/2833_663656/ 
2013 – “King Abdullah II touring the Huawei research center, Shanghai’s Jinqiao economic zone, and the first China-Arab States Expo in Ningxia.” https://www.theatlantic.com/china/archive/2013/09/jordan-chinas-gateway-to-the-middle-east/279988/                                  On July 10, 2018, State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi met in Beijing with Minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates Ayman Safadi of Jordan who was in China for the 8th Ministerial Meeting of the China-Arab States Cooperation Forum (CASCF).
Ayman Safadi noted Jordan stands ready to intensify coordination with China and work hard to well hold the next Ministerial Meeting. Jordan regards China as a major country with great influence in the world and always attaches importance to developing its relations with China. Jordan will continue to adhere to the one-China principle and support China's efforts in safeguarding its core interests.                   https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/eng/gjhdq_665435/2675_665437/2833_663656/2835_663660/201807/t20180712_533384.html  China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region and the Chinese embassy in Jordan held a video conference on Wednesday to show guests of Jordan the region's social and economic development.

Economy.evidence:
"At the 2015 China-Arab Expo, Jordan and China announced the signing of US$7 billion in investment agreements in what has been referred to as King Abdullah’s “Pivot to Asia”. Energy and transportation projects ruled the day, with the total package of agreements including a US$2.7 billion contract for the construction of a 900 MW shale-fired power plant and 1,000-megawatt renewable energy power plant, as well as a US$2.8 billion contract for a national railway network." https://www.policyforum.net/jordans-pivot-to-china/ 
"Attarat Power Company (“APCO”) announced that it has reached financial close for the USD 2.1 billion project to construct the first oil shale fired power station and open cast mine in Jordan...APCO is now owned 45% by YTL Power International of Malaysia, 45% by Guangdong Yudean Group Co. Limited of China, and 10% by Eesti Energia. The shareholders have committed to provide base shareholder funding of up to USD 528 million to fund the project." https://www.energia.ee/en/uudised/avaleht/-/newsv2/2017/03/20/attarat-power-company-viis-lopule-jordaania-polevkivielektrijaama-rahastamise

Technology.note:
https://www.tahawultech.com/industry/jordan-government-will-secretly-restrict-chinese-companies-from-5g/

The government also plans to rip-and-replace the existing core network and wireless equipment provided by Chinese vendors in 3 years. Society.note:
http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-10/28/c_138510229.htm
Jordanians flocked to watch a Chinese action movie which marked the start of a week-long Chinese Film Week in Jordan's capital Amman.
"This is a very good idea of holding a Chinese film week as we are used to watching Hollywood movies mainly," Adel Hatem, one of the audiences, told Xinhua.
"I enjoyed watching the Chinese movie today and I will tell my friends about this interesting experience," he added.
Deema Dahleh said after watching the movie that "when we watch the Chinese movies, we get to know more about Chinese culture and how to cope with Chinese people we meet in our lives as friends or colleagues."

2023 - Jordanians share similar views on China to those of their regional counterparts—a majority (65%) of Jordanians consider China an economic partner. In 2013, China provided humanitarian assistance to Jordan to help with the Syrian refugees in Jordan. https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/xybfs_663590/gjlb_663594/2833_663656/ 
“The People’s Republic of China has contributed USD 200,000 to IOM’s operation to provide medical aid and transport from the border to Za’atari refugee camp.
IOM has worked closely with the Jordanian Armed Forces at the border to provide medical screening and buses to transport over 100,000 new arrivals to the camp, since the site opened on July 29th 2012. Za’atari now houses over 60,000 people.”
https://www.iom.int/news/china-backs-iom-jordan-aid-syrian-refugees 
As of September 2021, the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) had delivered medical supplies and aid to at least 52 countries.
